intro: Adenocalymma cristicalyx, commonly known as the yellow flame tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, orange-yellow inflorescences that bloom in late summer. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven leaflets, and its flowers are typically clustered in panicles. It is often cultivated as an ornamental tree due to its striking floral display and adaptability to various soil types. The plant is also valued for its ability to thrive in full sun and its relatively low maintenance requirements.
